title: Automated Assembly Line Control
description:
An automated assembly line is responsible for inspecting, assembling, testing, and packaging products. Each step of the production line is controlled by a PLC and triggered by sensor and operator input signals.
Control requirements:
When the productSensor detects a product, it triggers the inspection device to start and continue working.
After inspection is complete, the operator uses the inspectionConfirmButton to trigger the inspection completion signal, automatically starting the assembly device for assembly.
After assembly is complete, the operator uses the assemblyConfirmButton to trigger the assembly completion signal, automatically starting the testing device for testing.
After testing is complete, the operator uses the testingConfirmButton to trigger the testing completion signal, starting the packaging device for packaging.
After packaging is complete, the operator uses the packingConfirmButton to trigger the packaging completion signal, lighting the packaging completion indicator light.
After the operator removes the packaged product, they press the resetButton to reset the indicator light and prepare for the next product production cycle.
name: LGF_ProductAssembly
